alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 6:26AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Carroll, south central Jo Daviess and central Jackson Counties through 700 AM CDT... At 625 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fulton, or 8 miles northwest of Maquoketa, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Andrew around 635 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Springbrook, Bellevue and Hanover. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
